intro: Didymocarpus crenatus, commonly known as the serrated didymocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves with serrated margins. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, capsule-like structure that splits open to release its seeds.
